intro: Thibaudia glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stigma.
